--------------------
Text: The Forests of Mara and Mondrem were adjacent medieval forests in Cheshire, England, which in the 11th century extended to over 60 sqmi , stretching from the Mersey in the north almost to Nantwich in the south, and from the Gowy in the west to the Weaver in the east.
Triplets:<The Forests of Mara
1:
--------------------
Text: Forests of Mara and Mondrem:  Mara and Mondrem were a hunting forest of the Norman Earls of Chester, established soon after 1071 by the first earl, Hugh d'Avranches.
Triplets:<Forests of Mara and Mondrem
3:
--------------------
Text: Forests of Mara and Mondrem:  Game included wild boar, and red, fallow and roe deer.
